p: In the Precipitation Change scenario, the TN and TP load presented a significantly positive correlation with the precipitation change ( Figure 7). Under the land use of 2014, when precipitation increased by 10%, 20%, −10% and −20% compared with the reference period, the monthly TN increased by 17.0% to 42.3%, 32.0% to 86.2%, −32.3% to −19.7% and −64.6% to −33.1%, respectively; the monthly TP increased by 14.4% to 51.6%, 29.8% to 111.6%, −37.6% to −20.8% and −67.5% to −34.9%, respectively; the average annual TN increased by 27.7%, 56.3%, −24.9% and −47.0%, respectively; and the average annual TP increased by 28.8%, 58.7%, −25.4% and −47.6%, respectively.
